All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension, org.eclipse.jface.util.IPropertyChangeListener, org.eclipse.ui.IPersistable, org.eclipse.ui.IViewPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart2, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart3, org.eclipse.ui.part.IWorkbenchPartOrientation, CameraListener
public class CameraView
extends uk.co.dancowan.robots.ui.views.ScrolledView
implements org.eclipse.jface.util.IPropertyChangeListener, CameraListener

Instance of an Eclipse ViewPart to enable vision command and camera output display in the application.

Extends ScrollableView to enable scroll bars at a preset minimum size.

Since:
version 1.0.0
Author:
Dan Cowan

Method Detail

getPartControl

public org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control getPartControl(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
Creates and lays out the widgets for this component on the passed Composite.

Although essentially based on SWT widgets and methodology this class uses an AWT Image placed on an AWT Canvas instance to assist with rendering the streamed image from the SRV1 Camera.

Specified by:
getPartControl in class uk.co.dancowan.robots.ui.views.ScrolledView
Parameters:
parent, - the Composite to add widgets to
Returns:
Composite the container of view's controls
See Also:
uk.co.dancowan.robots.ui.views.ScrolledView#getPartControl(Composite))

newImage

public void newImage()
Call-back from the CameraCanvas when a new AWT image has been received. Allows this class to refresh widgets as necessary.
